Well, BioShock Infinite is a mesmerizing game in terms of art style, graphics and sound design. However the plot is bizzare and makes less sense the more you think about it. Like all the time-travels and multiverses are cool and stuff, but adding them to the world of BioShock was unnecessary and forced in my opinion. BioShock has never been about them, it was about the terrors of progress and how good intentions lead to disasters. BS Infinite undoubtedly involves these topics, but the game feels like it doesn't belong to the franchise. They tried to fix it in the Burial at Sea DLCs, but only made it even more complicated and odd. I'm not going to spoil the plot here, maybe I'm just missing something and I don't want to mislead anyone with my bold assumptions. Nonetheless, BioShock Infinite as I have previously mentioned looks and plays amazing, so it deserves its high ratings

Just Get the Damn Bundle, man.... Enjoyable as hell. I really loved the change of scenery to Columbia. The gunplay, movement mechanics and the story.... AWESOME!
The only limiting thing is the two gun carry limit, but once you see past that and lean into the game, to you will really appreciate this feature (think Metro on harder difficulties).
Really spits out some thoughtful meta commentary of games, and speaking about anything is a goddamn spoiler.

Eu nunca tinha jogado nenhum jogo da franquia BioShock e peguei este de primeira.

O estilo do jogo é um FPS com foco narrativo.

Embora seja de 2013, seus gráficos ainda são impressionantes. A jogabilidade é ótima mesmo jogando no controle.

A trilha sonora é muito boa, estilo "música antiga", que combina perfeitamente com a ambientação da história.

A história é relativamente complexa mas bem instigante. Conforme você progride no jogo há várias reviravoltas e um final que não sei bem se eu entendi. Provavelmente quem tenha jogado os outros jogos deva compreender melhor, mas nada impede que você comece por este.

As legendas em português ajudam, mas haverá situações onde ou você foca no tiroteio ou morrerá lendo a legenda. O jogo tem opção para exibir algumas traduções de placas e outdoors da cidade, porém não funciona na maioria delas.

Eu joguei na dificuldade "Média" e achei desafiador em certos momentos, principalmente no final. Nessa dificuldade você pode ter duas armas de fogo por vez além dos "Vigores" (que são sua "magia" do jogo), com vários tipos que você pode alternar a qualquer momento. As fases costumam ter sempre o mesmo padrão no que diz respeito ao surgimento de inimigos, e depois de um tempo torna-se previsível.

Se você gosta de FPS e quer algum que seja rico em história, com um tema futurista mesclado com coisas antigas, recomendo este jogo. Espere por uma promoção e compre o pacote completo.

很久没有用震撼人心来形容一个游戏了，流畅的战斗，魔法与枪械相结合的奇幻世界，引人深思的剧情，完美诠释了什么才叫第九艺术，对于任何喜爱游戏的玩家来说它都称得上是一个藏在不起眼地方的宝藏。

Wow... Just wow! It's taken me this long to finally buy and commit to finishing this and it was wellllll worth it! It had me shocked at the end despite figuring out other plot twists throughout the game. Tried to get a few achievements and am proud of those. Definitely can get more than addictive to hunt for everything and get as much coin as you can (at the end, despite spending money, I still had 6,000 silver eagles and shouldn't have skimped on buying items), it is apparently super important to pay attention to all cutscenes and clues throughout, or you might be more confused and less mindblown at the end. Amazing experience, I'm downloading 1 and 2 now.

I really gave infinite a solid chance, but playing it right after bioshock 1 and 2 made it just feel wrong to play. The gunplay itself is far more engaging than the other two games, but the gameplay as a whole felt kind of wrong. Making gun ammo limited so you have to switch weapons (and limiting the guns you can carry) is a fine idea, but its poorly executed. Often times you'll get stuck using the vastly inferior "vox" variants of guns you've upgraded, and these weapons aren't worth the money to upgrade. Then there's the problem with vigors, which are just plasmids for people who are afraid of needles and genetic deformation. From a gameplay perspective, they're fine, but from a story perspective they're just downright stupid. The tie between vigors and plasmids via burial at sea (where they remove the injected plasmids, giving the whole thing a lazy reskin vibe) feels kinda like cheap fanservice and a cop out from writing more actual story, but given the rest of infinite's storyline, that very well may be a good thing. The story tries all sorts of wild twists, all of which are more confusing than engaging. The last act of the game lacks a satisfying final fight AND final cutscene, instead trying to leave players shocked, but instead leaving them unsatisfied. As a conclusion, Bioshock Infinite is NOT biologically shocking.

I don`t know why there was some sort of hate for this game back then. Sure it lost that certain charm from the previous games being under the sea, but damn, we are above the clouds in this one. But the game is fun, dynamic, and all over the place at certain points, but overall a good sequel, prequel, alternate dimension kind of game. Which ever you prefer. Only thing i don`t get is, why you can only have 2 weapons at a time, instead of a weapon wheel and upgrading them all along the way. For a 8 year old game, it looks and sounds great. And that fast paced shooting holds up really well. If you can get this game on sale with dlc-s , give it a go. It`s very good!

Сюжет закручен, как в Санта Барбаре. Геймплей такой же, как и в первых частях, но патронов и аптечек почти всегда хватает, не в последнюю очередь потому, что у нас появляется помощник, который помогает нам с поиском ammo и medkitов. Вначале игра захватывает, но часа через 3 сдувается и заёбывает однообразием, местами видна халтура и желание разработчиков растянуть игру подольше (бегать по одним и тем же локациям придётся не раз). Эта часть явно покруче первых двух, но не настолько, чтобы я мог рекомендовать её.

Con Infinite si cambia totalmente ambientazione e si va in una città in mezzo alle nuvole.
La qualità del gioco fortunatamente torna ad essere quella del primo capitolo, dopo l'appena discreto Bioshock 2.
La trama è un po' cervellotica, ma nello stesso tempo avvincente e geniale.

Stesso giudizio per i due dlc Burial at Sea, dove invece si torna a Rapture in una sorta di sequel di Infinite e prequel del primo Bioshock.
